scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Discharge certificate presented to Major Maxwell Davidson, 5th Princess Charlotte of Wales Dragoon Guards. Upon leaving a regiment, each soldier would obtain a parchment certificate (form WO64). This would help to confirm his identity and be used as a reference for future employment. The certificate would indicate the number of years of service, reason for discharge, date of enlistment and comments on character and conduct.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Major Davidson was enlisted at Dublin, Ireland, in 1845 at the age of fourteen, remaining in service for 25 years and 202 days “towards good conduct pay and pension.” He was awarded Turkish Medals for service in the Crimean battles of Sevastopol, Balaclava, and Inkerman; a French War Medal for Valor and Discipline; and a Silver Medal for Long Service and Good Conduct.
